task.title: Viewing Pipeline Commit History
task.shortdesc: You can view the commit history of any pipeline that has been published to . If the pipeline has been committed multiple times, you can get an older version of the pipeline and then continue editing the older version.

context.p: pipelinescommit historycommit historypipelinesControl Hubpipeline commit historyIf you edit and then publish an older version, updates the minor version number rather than the major version number. For example, you have a pipeline with three versions. You get version 2 of the pipeline, edit the pipeline, and then publish the pipeline. versions the current pipeline as 2.1. So you now have four versions of the pipeline, with version 2.1 of the pipeline marked as the current version:

step.cmd: In the pipeline canvas, click the SCH Options icon , and then click Commit History.
step.info: The Pipeline Commit History dialog box opens. For example, a pipeline with three versions displays the commit history as follows:

step.cmd: To get an older version of a pipeline, click Get in the Actions column for that version.
step.info: opens the selected pipeline version in the canvas. You can make edits to the pipeline version, and then publish the pipeline as another version.
